description: Borrowed from Middle French décomposer. Equivalent to de- +‎ compose.

verbs.description: decompose (third-person singular simple present decomposes, present participle decomposing, simple past and past participle decomposed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To separate or break down (something) into its components; to disintegrate or fragment.

examples: Plastics can take centuries to decompose.
